snippet: The new Congress members arrived eager and optimistic, even though some had not found places to live and were having challenges finding where they needed to go in the Capitol.
abstract: Many freshmen members of Congress are still transitioning to their roles; some have not yet found housing in Washington, while others are grappling with how to navigate Capitol building and adjust to rhythms of policy-making in nation's capital.
lead_paragraph: The new Congress members arrived eager and optimistic, even though some had not found places to live and were having challenges finding where they needed to go in the Capitol.

headline.main: As Power in Congress Shifts to G.O.P., Lives of Freshmen in Transition
headline.print_headline: As Power in Congress Shifts to G.O.P., Lives of Freshmen in Transition
